programme.desc: The three motoring enthusiasts head to Spain on a mission to help its struggling economy - but the convertible supercars they take are very expensive and anything but discreet. With Jeremy Clarkson in a McLaren MP4-12C, Richard Hammond driving a Ferrari 458 and James May behind the wheel of an Audi R8 V10, the trio encounter mountain passes, empty towns and an abandoned airport before creating their own street circuit in a deserted Madrid development. Plus, Sherlock star Benedict Cumberbatch sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a project to build a car that can turn into a hovercraft and bring relief to flooded areas. Their efforts do not start smoothly, but it is not long before the trio are demonstrating the brilliance of their creation with an eventful journey down the River Avon. Plus, Jeremy grabs the keys to two variants of the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG supercar - the V8-engined Black Series with a roaring 622bhp, and the 740bhp Electric Drive, which is powered by four electric motors. X-Men and Les Miserables star Hugh Jackman is the latest celebrity to take the new Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around 2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around 2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: CS gas is used to stop a crazed axeman, a drunk student cannot understand why he's being arrested and a joker insults a cop but uses his charm to avoid arrest.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality TV show following the exploits of eccentric master fabricator Steve Darnell. He and the gang turn a Chevy C10 into a monster of a car, complete with scars and rivets.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson drives the Jaguar F-Type sports car on some of Britain's finest roads, while Richard Hammond jumps inside the Range Rover Sport and gives it a thorough workout off-road, on a track and in what he believes is its most natural habitat - the lanes of Cheshire. James May goes for a countryside adventure in the New Routemaster London bus brought into use in 2013, which is propelled by a turbodiesel generator and a powerful electric motor. Inspired by the machines they have tested, the trio then meet to celebrate Britain's motor industry with a grand finale in front of Buckingham Palace. Plus, former Formula One driver Mark Webber takes to the track for a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson attempts to build a car that is even smaller than the Peel P50 and then tests it out on the streets of London before pitching his concept in the Dragons' Den. James May puts the Bentley Continental GT Speed through its paces by taking it on a rally stage, while Richard Hammond drives the new Pagani Huayra hypercar before handing it over to the Stig. Actor Damian Lewis goes for a spin in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Bill Bailey, Colin Lane and Desiree Burch join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer host Sandi Toksvig's questions on the theme 'Overseas', in an extended edition of the unorthodox quiz. During the course of the show, the panellists find out about Allotment Annies as well as who keeps their brothers in a cage. The fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers the questionmaster considers most interesting, though not necessarily correct.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio of motoring enthusiasts embark on another epic road trip, this time across western America in front-engined supercars. Jeremy Clarkson pilots the Lexus LFA, which has a spectacularly high-revving V10 powerplant, Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the muscular Dodge Viper, and James May opts for the latest incarnation of Aston Martin's Vanquish. On their journey from Las Vegas to Palm Springs via Los Angeles, the presenters tackle racing circuits and find themselves in a race against the police, before rushing to the Mexican border - and there's a terrifying penalty for the last man to arrive. Meanwhile, Fleetwood Mac drummer Mick Fleetwood rolls up his sleeves to thrash the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a race from London's Wembley Stadium to Milan's San Siro, the home of Italian football giants AC and Inter. A price restriction leads Jeremy to grab the keys to a Shelby Mustang GT500, which costs the equivalent of 35,000 in America and packs a supercharged punch of more than 650bhp. James and Richard pin their hopes on the pan-European rail network in a bid to secure the prize of tickets to a top-flight football match, with nothing but a long journey home awaiting the losers. On the test track, Jeremy puts Toyota's GT86 coupe through its paces, and its promise of entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling should put a smile on his face. Plus, singer-songwriter Amy Macdonald gets to grips with the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites another three celebrities to reveal their pet hates in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Actor, comedian and game-show host Alexander Armstrong reveals how he finds certain cocktail ingredients pointless, athlete Kelly Holmes is fed up of being given the runaround by the M25, and veteran sports commentator Henry Blofeld argues that people talking to him at breakfast simply isn't cricket.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack's not having much luck with lights these days, whether it's the fizzling sign at the start of this show, the blackout during his recent Sheffield gig, or the dimly lit area at the start of this seventh series. Lee and Lucy have enjoyed a spot of culture at their local cinema, but the sparkle of a French movie is soon diminished when the romantic walk home finds them in an imposing underpass. She has her handbag stolen by a bunch of cocky youths from under his nose. Given the fact the layabout failed to protect her, or come up with an accurate description of their muggers, Lee feels the urge to prove his manliness, but will a spell at the local boxing ring be a help or a hindrance? Sally Bretton and Katy Wix also star.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: A wealthy new couple move into the block and soon find out that sharing a building with Lee and Lucy is anything but straightforward. The fun begins when Lee somehow manages to bag an invitation to a christening party being thrown by the couple - sending him and Lucy on a last-minute gift-buying trip, during which they make every wrong decision humanly possible to find the perfect present for the baby who seems to have everything. Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden join the cast, with Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy decides she wants to have a baby, but what she didn't expect was for the whole family to take a personal interest in the conception. Lee thinks he should be the one, of course - so he can't believe it when she reveals she is planning to have the child with another man. programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson travels along the north Norfolk coast through one of the least developed spots in Britain, finding out how the area maintained its rural, remote identity despite the dynamic industrial changes of the Victorian age. From the arrival of Bertie, Prince of Wales at Sandringham House to the opening of Cromer Pier, Tony's four-day walk sees him learn about key periods in the county's history. He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston looks at the life and work of Serbian inventor Nikola Tesla, investigating conspiracy theories that the scientific establishment and national governments covered up his work on energy sources. He also finds out why so little evidence of his experiments remains today.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.

Meanwhile, anthropologist Alice Roberts visits the Isle of Wight, where she meets the men who helped launch Britain's first satellite.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how the arrival of winter sparks a ruthless battle for survival in the polar regions, with temperatures plummeting to -70C, winds reaching 120mph and day-long darkness. As a blizzard rages, a polar bear treks into the Arctic mountains to give birth, while the entire world population of spectacled eider braves the weather in a giant ice hole. Wolves and bison engage in battle, but alliances are also made, and beneath the snow, voles try to dodge the attacks of great grey owls and weasels.

programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A highway built in the Brazilian jungle as an escape route in the event of an emergency at a nuclear power station, a Soviet fortress and Ellis Island hospital.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Luftwaffe's bombing raids on Britain's provincial cities, when Coventry and Plymouth were hardest hit, although Portsmouth, Glasgow, Sheffield and Bristol also suffered heavy casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The programme looks at a mysterious group of rusting ships stranded in an arid desert, and a monstrous defensive line on the snow-covered peaks of the Italian Alps.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The role played by engineering giant Vickers during the Second World War, including the development of the Spitfire and how the Royal Navy recovered from losing so many warships.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Whistler on the Canadian Pacific seaboard, a remote mountain town whose creation was made possible with record-breaking engineering equipment, helping establish one of the best ski resorts in the world.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The extension of the Panama Canal to accommodate the world's largest ships, which drew inspiration from the work of 17th-century engineer Hugues Cosnier.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Questions regarding the authenticity of the Jehoash Tablet, a religious artifact containing an ancient inscription.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Egyptologist David Rohl searches for the location of the Tower of Babel, a Biblical structure which first appeared in the Book of Genesis.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Calls to reinvestigate the suspicious death of King Ludwig of Bavaria in 1886, who died three days after he was declared insane and deposed from the throne.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The historians reveal how the railways transformed the British diet, rescuing a nation that was struggling to feed itself. Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn discover how the mass transportation of livestock gave birth to the traditional British roast, and Ruth Goodman is in Whitby, which became a thriving fishing town thanks to the North Yorkshire Moors Railway supplying its kippers. Plus, Hampshire's watercress line, which brought nutritional salad to the masses, and how the use of steam-powered engines revolutionised production at Britain's oldest brewery.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The historians take a trip on the Flying Scotsman, arguably the most famous locomotive in the world, along its original route connecting London and Edinburgh - the two most important financial capitals of the Empire. Peter Ginn explores how the railways revolutionised the delivery of mail across Britain, he and Alex Langlands learn about the first electronic communication service - more than 100 years before the arrival of email - and Ruth finds out about the role of the wheeltapper. Plus, why do some railway clocks have more than one minute hand?.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The historians explore the life of the South Devon branch line before the Beeching cuts of the 1960s. Peter Ginn joins a footplate crew and receives coal-shovelling tips from a veteran steam engine driver of 63 years' experience, and with Alex he learns about one of Scotland's most lucrative exports. Ruth Goodman finds out about the dangers involved in working on the Victorian railways, and how those who lost limbs were catered for by a dedicated prosthetics workshop. She also discovers how the railways came to the rescue when a deadly disease wiped out almost the entire stock of London cattle.

programme.title: Full Steam Ahead
programme.desc: The team discover how the combination of increased leisure time and affordable rail transport brought a new kind of freedom for working-class Victorians. Ruth Goodman travels along the south Devon coast from Paignton to Kingswear, where she helps prepare a paddle steamer for a journey up the River Dart, while at Swanage, Peter Ginn finds out what it was like to work on the excursion trains and the impact mass tourism had on the area.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: High-definition cameras and aerial photography techniques are used to explore the archipelago, which is rich in wildlife and made famous by Charles Darwin's On the Origin of the Species. This programme focuses on the geological history of the islands through the evidence of volcanic eruptions and examines what makes it unique. Tilda Swinton narrates.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Examining the lesser-known parts of the islands and the species that have successfully evolved to suit the environment. The programme discovers how tortoise shells have changed shape, flowers have turned yellow to attract bees, and finches have become warblers. Plus, how flightless cormorants are still hunting underwater. Narrated by Tilda Swinton.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: An insight into how creatures adapt to the islands' extremes of weather, including iguanas that climb more than 1,000 metres to lay eggs, fish forced to rely on the shade provided by mangroves, and seals that survive on exposed shorelines by taking shelter in lava grottos.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Performances by punk and new wave acts on the music show in 1977, including the Stranglers and the Jam, plus the continuing power of disco exemplified by Donna Summer's I Feel Love, the reggae of Bob Marley and pub rock by acts such as Eddie and the Hot Rods. Insight into performing on the programme comes from musicians including John Otway, JJ Burnel of the Stranglers, Paul Cook of the Sex Pistols, members of Darts and the Adverts, as well as contributions from Nicky Wire, Alexis Petridis and Pete Paphides.

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Documentary about the change of musical direction in 1978, when pop singles were slowly ousted by disco, punk and new wave artists. The programme features contributions by members of the Boomtown Rats, Squeeze, Boney M and Sham 69 - among others - and archive performances by the likes of Elvis Costello, the Undertones, Ian Dury and the Blockheads and the Jam.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Tower of London
programme.desc: An exploration of British landmarks, beginning with a look at the Tower of London - which has served as a castle, a jail and a place of execution.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Kensington Palace in London, which began life as an early 17th-century Jacobean mansion before becoming a palace fit for the monarchy, and was the brainchild of Christopher Wren.

programme.desc: Eleanor unwittingly saves the life of a brutal East End villain, who begins terrorising patients and staff alike. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Steve Evans meets a mystery woman and soon realises that she is more closely linked to the army than he would like. Mark finds himself breaking the law.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Rob probes the circumstances of Jimmy Cross's shooting and learns the truth about his father's murder, sending him on a mission of vengeance that culminates in a tense stand-off. Elsewhere, Abi's kidnapper sends Samantha a macabre message that leads her to an equally sinister website, and Phil taunts Neil over his affair with Andrea.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Rosie is sedated in maternity and wakes up to find she cannot remember the tragic events of the previous week. Will's attitude problem causes trouble in the canteen, leading to another run-in with Connie. Jess tells Sean she is not ready to break the news about the baby to her father - but that's the least of her worries after she goes for a scan.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Charlie's colleagues demonstrate their support for him in the sexual harassment case being brought by Mrs O'Donnell, while a local journalist claims to have injured his wrist in a bid to get to the heart of the story.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The hunt for Abi Nixon's kidnapper takes on renewed urgency when it appears she is being held captive in a sealed container with only a couple of hours' oxygen left. programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Celestine tries to reassure Etta about Lloyd, and Sharon is upset about Grant making plans for the future without consulting her.

programme.desc: The antiques dealer is asked to sell a sinister-looking mirror from a ballet school, and determines to finally marry Lady Jane. However, the object of his affections has some shocking news for him that suggests he may have left matters too late. Roger Lloyd Pack (Trigger in Only Fools and Horses) guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Ice maiden Philippa Vale shows up in Jersey just as a large diamond is about to be auctioned - and sure enough, it soon disappears. Liza Goddard guests alongside John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Freddie's sea-faring brother dies, so the Boswells decide it would be fitting to arrange a burial at sea. Carla Lane's comedy, starring Jean Boht and Ronald Forfar.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The store advertises on Citizen Band radio, but unfortunately Mrs Slocombe's attempt to publicise her underwear attracts the attentions of the wrong type of customer. Shop-floor comedy, with Mollie Sugden and featuring the voice of Robbie Coltrane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean opens another secretarial agency, but needs someone to run it. Work for Lionel seems to have dried up, giving her cause for concern. Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg comes off his bike after cycling downhill and sustains a fractured foot. Truly believes that the accident would never have happened if the vehicle had been fitted with studded tyres - and immediately sets about organising a practical demonstration of his theory.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The maverick High Court Judge's daughter is arrested during a demonstration, presenting him with the challenge of getting her off the hook without falling foul of powerful enemies he has made in his single-minded push to the top of the legal profession. Martin Shaw, Donald Sinden and Caroline Langrishe star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: UCOS looks into the murder of a private investigator who was stabbed through the heart in a suspected robbery gone wrong. The answers may lie with the victim's last three cases, but it'll take the whole team's expertise to crack the codes within his mysterious notebook. The movements of a rare stamp could hold the key to the investigation - if only UCOS could track it down. Meanwhile, Steve has problems when he rents out his flat.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Jardine and Taggart investigate the murder of a pensioner, focusing their inquiries on his daughter and son-in-law. Unfortunately, the case soon takes an unexpected turn. Glasgow-set detective drama, starring Mark McManus and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: The Lost World
programme.desc: Trapped on the plateau, Edward, Agnes and Lord Roxton set out in search of professors Challenger and Summerlee, following their capture by the strange apemen who may provide the missing link between modern man and prehistoric life. But when they mount a rescue, the explorers are confronted by a native tribe. Conclusion of the adventure, starring Bob Hoskins, Peter Falk and James Fox.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Mark and Cate's new baby falls ill, which prompts a revelation from Cate. Meanwhile, Butcher and Stacey grow closer when he rescues a soldier.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The hunt for Abi Nixon's kidnapper takes on renewed urgency when it appears she is being held captive in a sealed container with only a couple of hours' oxygen left. Psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis reckons the taunting messages sent by the culprit point to an old adversary with a grudge, and soon pinpoints a likely suspect, while Phil offers the distraught Sam solace in her darkest hour.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Rosie suffers complications with her pregnancy and has to undergo an emergency Caesarean, but the outcome has heartbreaking repercussions for all concerned. Jess tries to get out of her quandary by telling Sean she is going to have an abortion, though he begs her not to go through with it. Connie suspends Will after he unwittingly talks to a journalist about the canteen strike he caused.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A man fractures his right leg in two places and cracks a rib after the walls of a well fall onto him. Tragedy strikes after Josh is asked to attend a fire at his own home, while Matt hands in his resignation and makes plans to move to Crete.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Samantha is appalled when it becomes clear that psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis has brainwashed Abi, who not only refuses to name him as her kidnapper but agrees to return home with him. The situation becomes even more dire when Peter Baxter is charged with the abduction, leaving Samantha wondering how she can convince her colleagues of the terrible truth. Meanwhile, sexy new recruit PC Amber Johannsen turns heads at Sun Hill, although Gina is unimpressed by her slipshod approach to police work, and Ramani crosses swords with an abusive wife and mother.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian entertains an important business client, while Pat sets Frank a daunting task.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Dot fears the launderette has been broken into, Ian is looking troubled, Clyde and Hattie are sure that Lloyd is up to no good, while Frank makes Dot an offer she cannot refuse.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A dramatic warehouse fire in London requires every fire squad in the area to deal, leaving the rest of the city vulnerable to unfortunate mishaps. The Blue Watch team is called in to deal with such an emergency when a nuclear fuel train comes to a stop, and Tate makes a frightening discovery.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Left to look after Felsham Hall until it has been sold, Lovejoy uses the house as a furniture showroom. It seems unlikely anyone could replace Lady Jane in the dodgy dealer's affections - but that doesn't prevent his eye being caught by glamorous auctioneer Charlotte Cavendish. Charlie Gimbert eventually buys the property, and agrees to rent the stables for Lovejoy Antiques. Patricia Hayes guest stars in an episode directed by Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A pair of rich fashion designers are too preoccupied to realise their child's nanny is not all she seems. When their worst nightmare comes true and their baby is abducted, it is up to Jim to track them down. John Nettles stars, with Sheila Ruskin and Duncan Preston.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Aveline bares all for the front cover of a magazine, Adrian finds himself out of a job and a card game leaves Freddie 500 in debt.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The gang visits 10 Downing Street to campaign against a Japanese takeover - and Mrs Slocombe gets a chance to demonstrate that Britain has women even more formidable than Mrs Thatcher. Comedy, starring Mollie Sugden and John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean searches for a manager to run the agency, while Lionel gets to work on the outline for an American mini-series based on their real-life romance. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Smiler reminisces about a woman who escaped his advances during the war without leaving her contact details, so Truly, Alvin and Billy volunteer to track her down - even though it means a foray into hostile territory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Brian Murphy, Keith Clifford and Stephen Lewis.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: A concerned mother hires Hetty to find out who is stalking her daughter just days before her wedding. It's not long before the unlikely sleuth is on the trail of a disgraced soldier with a grudge against the father of the bride-to-be. Light-hearted drama, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Spin-off from Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries, set in the 1960s, following Miss Fisher's niece, who sets out to investigate what happened to her aunt. In the first of a two-part story, Peregrine Fisher arrives in Melbourne to collect her inheritance from her aunt, Phryne Fisher. Wanting to be part of the same Adventuresses' Club as her aunt, Peregrine decides to follow in Phryne's footsteps and solve the murder of a dead model at a bridal fashion show. Geraldine Hakewill stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A skeleton uncovered in the foundations of a swimming pool is identified as a young lottery winner named Cheryl, who was reported missing 17 years ago. The prime suspects are her fellow quiz team-mates, who won their lucky windfall as part of a syndicate, and while some have put their money to good use, the victim's boyfriend has fallen on hard times and the media remain convinced he is the key to her murder. As allegations of affairs, fights and betrayal begin to surface, the team is left to ponder whether money really is the root of all evil.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A body is discovered in the boot of a vehicle that has just been through the car crusher, presenting Taggart and Jardine with a case that seems to connect the worlds of drug dealers and artists. Mark McManus and James Macpherson star.

programme.title: Lorna Doone
programme.desc: Lavish adaptation of RD Blackmore's novel of lovers, outlaws and warring families in 17th-century Exmoor. Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The successful spring collection brings a surprise proposal for the future that threatens the sisters' partnership.

programme.desc: Tricia has a very emotional day comforting her friend Maggie Thornton in her final hours, and Mickie tries to console Mubbs, who is in a foul mood over Rosie and the baby. Will refuses to apologise to the canteen staff and has to endure taunts about his aristocratic background. programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Josh confides in Baz over the devastation of losing his family, while Matt tells Jude he is going to Crete in part because of the upset over the abortion. The battle between two warring families spills into the hospital wards.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim makes a partial confession to June about his debts, leaving her in no mood to enjoy her retirement party, preferring to drown her sorrows rather than facing up to the reality of her husband's betrayal. As the booze flows freely, Amber makes a bee-line for Steve and promptly seduces the virginal copper - doubtless setting the scene for plenty of emotional tempests to come. By contrast, Ramani's professionalism impresses Jack so much he puts her in charge of a new Vulnerable Persons Unit.

programme.title: Lovejoy

Meanwhile, newcomer Beth Taylor gives Eric and Tinker a helping hand. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim is assigned to protect a demanding tennis player who has received several death threats. The amiable cop tries to keep his personal feelings in check in the course of his professional duties. John Nettles and Reece Dinsdale star.

programme.desc: Jack's van is held up at gunpoint and Adrian announces he has found a girlfriend. Meanwhile, Billy becomes increasingly frustrated over Julie's attitude to their relationship.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mrs Slocombe's beloved cat goes missing, so she turns to Mr Humphries for support in her hour of need. Fearing the feline may never return, the staff buy her a kitten. John Inman and Mollie Sugden star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel travel to Los Angeles to discuss turning their story into a film, but the brash executive deciding their fate doesn't allay their fears. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Afterthoughts of a Co-op Manager
programme.desc: Truly discovers a former suitor of Marina's went off to Australia, and convinces her the emigrant did so to forget about her - and that she should stop seeing Howard out of respect to the other man's memory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Jean Fergusson and Robert Fyfe.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The murder of famous cricketer Kenneth Waring presents Lynley with a fresh challenge to his deductive powers _ and as the case unfolds, he is forced to break the rules in a desperate bid to lure the killer into the open. Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Lesley Vickerage star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The penultimate episode sees the retired detectives investigating possibly their most difficult cold case yet. A bloodstained bust is uncovered during construction work in a cemetery and the evidence points to the murder of an alternative-medicine practitioner seven years earlier. Further clues lead to the controversial world of cryopreservation - the practice of keeping clinically dead patients frozen to extend their life cycle. Sasha is determined they don't put a foot wrong - but with the sobering possibility that two perpetrators are still at large, the detectives are forced to go out on a limb.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Craggy cop Jim Taggart investigates the murder of an undertaker found in a burnt-out car, and soon realises that all the evidence points to local French teacher Francoise Campbell, whose pupils seem strangely anxious to protect her. Whodunit, starring Mark McManus, James MacPherson, Iain Anders and Robert Robertson.

programme.title: Lorna Doone
programme.desc: Lavish adaptation of RD Blackmore's novel of lovers, outlaws and warring families in 17th-century Exmoor. Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Jack arrives home drunk, Aveline puts her desire for a baby on hold, and Nellie meets her admirer in the park.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits a Japanese-style horticultural haven in St Mawgan, Cornwall - open to the public under the National Gardens Scheme - complete with oriental plants including bamboo and bonsai.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Period medical drama chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Angela's career causes problems for her and Chris and Major Forrester is forced to make a difficult decision. Starring Fiona Bell and James Callis.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim makes a partial confession to June about his debts, leaving her in no mood to enjoy her retirement party, preferring to drown her sorrows rather than facing up to the reality of her husband's betrayal. As the booze flows freely, Amber makes a bee-line for Steve and promptly seduces the virginal copper - doubtless setting the scene for plenty of emotional tempests to come. By contrast, Ramani's professionalism impresses Jack so much he puts her in charge of a new Vulnerable Persons Unit.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jess tells Zubin she is pregnant and moving in with Sean, but is stunned by his reaction, while Tricia is haunted by her failed marriage in the wake of Maggie's death. Mickie's date with Mubbs doesn't go as well as either of them hoped and she decides to face reality, confessing to Will she is gay but urging him to keep it a secret. The Crouches' Mona Hammond guest stars.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Liz has reservations regarding Josh being in the right frame of mind as he returns to work. A glamorous former colleague of Richard's appears on the wards, while Matt's party goes awry as be bids farewell to his colleagues and prepares to head to Crete.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As June prepares for her final day at Sun Hill, Jim finally comes clean and reveals the full extent of his gambling debts - but far from saving his marriage, the admission causes her to storm off in disgust, swearing to have nothing more to do with him. And just when Jim thinks things couldn't possibly get any worse, the hapless copper is abducted and roughed up by vicious loan shark Zaccadelli. Elsewhere, Yvonne discovers her sister has been attacked at home and suspects Shirley is responsible, while Steve is cock-a-hoop after his night with Amber - but she soon brings him down to earth.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ricky is curious about Sam's secretiveness, Pauline makes plans for her New Zealand trip, Dot fears for the laundrette's future, and Celestine waits for a decision from Etta.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Gill fears that Mark will not be able to cope with the difficult times ahead.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Scase and Tate are both disciplined by Area Commander Bulstrode. Elsewhere, the Blue Watch attend a blaze at the cafe across the road. Starring Sean Blowers and James Marcus.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: Three Men and a Brittle Lady
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer offers to track down a conman after Charlie is swindled out of a china figurine. He also helps Charlotte find the thieves who've robbed her house. Drama, guest starring Lionel Jeffries and Eve Matheson.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: An actor playing the part of a German commandant in a war film receives death threats from someone evidently still resentful over the island's past Nazi occupation. Warren Clarke guest stars, with John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Billy wrestles with the prospect of fatherhood as Julie prepares to give birth. A devastated Adrian prepares to visit the unemployment agency, but is reassured by Joey's guidance of such occasions. Comedy, starring Nick Conway, Jonathon Morris and Peter Howitt.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The staff at Grace Brothers are up in arms when it is decided that those who have reached a certain age are to be made redundant - leaving Mrs Slocombe facing the sack. They are far from appeased when they meet her successor. Comedy, starring Mollie Sugden.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean insists on going back to work having returned from LA, certain she can overcome jet lag, but Lionel just wants to rest. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Auntie Wainwright is thrilled to have picked up a bargain at the auction rooms, but puzzled as to what the object is. Worse yet, when she does find out what her purchase is meant for, she still has no idea what to do with it. Long-running comedy series, starring Jean Alexander, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: The Murdochs' housewarming party is cut short when a man is cooked to the point of exploding in a closet-sized microwave prototype. Return of the crime drama, starring Yannick Bisson.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A British cop is murdered on the Caribbean island of Saint Marie, and the local commissioner declares another officer from the UK must be flown over to lead the investigation. Enter DI Richard Poole, a brilliant detective with a unique approach to cracking crime, and just the man to solve the mystery of his colleague's death. The only problem is, he is totally unsuited to a life of sun, sea and sand - and worse still, it seems his boss back home wants him to stay there. First episode of the drama, starring Ben Miller, Sara Martins, Lenora Crichlow, Don Warrington, Danny John-Jules and Sean Maguire.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a political activist 15 years earlier but, just as it is getting somewhere, Ted orders the investigation to be halted and Ucos is threatened with closure following its perceived mishandling of the Hanway case. However, the team refuses to give up, and finds evidence of a cover-up involving top officials and a multi-national drugs company. Guest starring Meera Syal and Lorraine Ashbourne.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Two skulls are found during the construction of a new bypass, and the detective investigates a possible link to the theft of poisonous snakes from a Glasgow research laboratory. Drama, starring Mark McManus, Blythe Duff and Dougray Scott.

programme.title: Mansfield Park
programme.desc: First of a six-part Jane Austen adaptation, starring Sylvestra Le Touzel as an impoverished young woman adopted into the household of her reluctant wealthy relatives.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: The past begins to catch up with 12th-century sleuth Brother Cadfael as he investigates the case of a wealthy landowner murdered shortly after disinheriting his son. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi, Sean Pertwee, Peter Copley, Sophie Lawrence and Julian Firth.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dodgy dealer is asked to furnish a restaurant, but the items he acquires turn out to be stolen. To make matters worse, the owners turn up for the establishment's opening night. John Wells guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer is asked to track down an itinerant painter who holds the key to a shameful secret. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Despatched by Munro to kill a French colonel, Sharpe is wounded in battle and hovers at death's door - but Harper and a mute nun nurse him back to health. Once recovered, he sets out in search of vengeance with a newly forged sword. Period adventure, starring Sean Bean and Daragh O'Malley.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Bomber learns his daughter has run away, and immediately flies home to lend his wife moral support - unaware the young lady in question is winging her way to Dusseldorf to be with him. Comedy drama, starring Pat Roach, Tim Healy, Gary Holton and Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Brenda makes it clear that she thinks Neville is living it up in Germany just as a leather-clad local girl, whom he merely shared a taxi with, accuses him of assaulting her. Cult comedy drama, starring Kevin Whately, Tim Healy and Julia Tobin.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Spin-off from Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries, set in the 1960s, following Miss Fisher's niece, who sets out to investigate what happened to her aunt. In the first of a two-part story, Peregrine Fisher arrives in Melbourne to collect her inheritance from her aunt, Phryne Fisher. Wanting to be part of the same Adventuresses' Club as her aunt, Peregrine decides to follow in Phryne's footsteps and solve the murder of a dead model at a bridal fashion show. Geraldine Hakewill stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The mysterious disappearance of an old friend leads Father Brown and Sid on a quest to find the mythical Lannington Rosary, and an old adversary, seemingly back from the dead, must be trusted to help. Mark Williams stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Armed only with a telescope, the priest hopes that a broken leg will not prevent him from solving the mystery surrounding the death of a member of Kembleford's Women's Institute. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack, Nancy Carroll and Tom Chambers.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: A groom-to-be is shot dead while on a hunting excursion during his stag trip. Though apparently an accident, none of his accompanying friends will admit to firing the bullet. Neill Rea stars.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Julia refuses to accept the blame when one of her patients dies after surgery, and her investigations reveal an unusual pattern of deaths among alcoholics on the ward.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Fantasy drama, starring John Simm as a detective who ends up in a coma while pursuing a serial killer - and when he comes round, he finds he has somehow been transported back to 1973. As he attempts to uncover what has happened to him, he must also contend with the macho behaviour of his Sweeneyesque colleagues, as well as a murderer whose crimes are oddly similar to the one he was investigating in his own time.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam learns Gene has planted evidence on a notorious armed robber, and decides to let him go. However, the crook then continues his crime spree, critically wounding a cleaner from the police station in the process. The idealistic detective begins to question whether his colleague's approach might be justified - but fears his doubts could affect his chances of returning to the 21st century.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The beleaguered barrister puts aside his domestic problems to defend a prostitute on the charge of murdering a high-profile businessman - a tricky case made all the more difficult by the discovery that she has many enemies, all of them determined to blacken her character. Drama, starring John Thaw.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack and Strickland form an unlikely alliance that sees them break the rules to find out why a British soldier died while taking part in a Ministry of Defence medical trial. With three of the man's colleagues now suffering from psychological, drink or memory problems, the team considers whether he died as a result of the experiment, or if he was a victim of a cover-up by the Army.

programme.title: Mansfield Park
programme.desc: Part two of six. While Sir Thomas is overseas, a prosperous family arrives in the neighbourhood. Jane Austen adaptation, starring Sylvestra Le Touzel.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Neil is alarmed that medical tests failed to reveal a patient's illness, and an emergency vaccination programme is hurriedly set up to deal with a suspected outbreak of smallpox.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Rob probes the circumstances of Jimmy Cross's shooting and learns the truth about his father's murder, sending him on a mission of vengeance that culminates in a tense stand-off. Elsewhere, Abi's kidnapper sends Samantha a macabre message that leads her to an equally sinister website, and Phil taunts Neil over his affair with Andrea.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The hunt for Abi Nixon's kidnapper takes on renewed urgency when it appears she is being held captive in a sealed container with only a couple of hours' oxygen left. Psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis reckons the taunting messages sent by the culprit point to an old adversary with a grudge, and soon pinpoints a likely suspect, while Phil offers the distraught Sam solace in her darkest hour.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Samantha is appalled when it becomes clear that psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis has brainwashed Abi, who not only refuses to name him as her kidnapper but agrees to return home with him. The situation becomes even more dire when Peter Baxter is charged with the abduction, leaving Samantha wondering how she can convince her colleagues of the terrible truth. Meanwhile, sexy new recruit PC Amber Johannsen turns heads at Sun Hill, although Gina is unimpressed by her slipshod approach to police work, and Ramani crosses swords with an abusive wife and mother.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim makes a partial confession to June about his debts, leaving her in no mood to enjoy her retirement party, preferring to drown her sorrows rather than facing up to the reality of her husband's betrayal. As the booze flows freely, Amber makes a bee-line for Steve and promptly seduces the virginal copper - doubtless setting the scene for plenty of emotional tempests to come. By contrast, Ramani's professionalism impresses Jack so much he puts her in charge of a new Vulnerable Persons Unit.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The local Blainthorp Music Festival celebrates its 50th birthday, bringing with it fierce competition. The sleuth is called in to investigate why competitors have mysteriously started to lose their voices. Light-hearted drama, with Patricia Routledge, Dominic Monaghan and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Mayor Makepeace hires Hetty to track down his runaway daughter, revealing that she has absconded with her boyfriend and could be in grave danger since both suffer from learning disabilities. Drama, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Gambling Man
programme.desc: Robson Green stars in the title role as Rory Connor, a rent collector who spends his nights at the gaming tables, secure in the knowledge that nobody can turn a card quite like him. Unfortunately, as the stakes get higher, Connor finds himself gambling more than money - with dramatic consequences for himself and those around him. Feature-length drama, with Bernard Hill and Sylvestra Le Touzel.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Cynthia is concerned during a visit as she feels new mum Pamela is overly anxious, so Dr Turner arranges for a psychiatrist to come in. However, they soon discover both mother and baby have gone missing. Meanwhile, Jenny, on secondment, begins to see cracks in the establishment, Chummy discovers her mother has walked out on her father, and Trixie struggles to hide her disappointment when Tom cancels a date. Guest starring Sophie Rundle (The Bletchley Circle).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny is assigned to first-time mother Jeanette, who requires frequent visits during a protracted labour, and when she meets her patient's cousin, Philip, a new friendship begins to grow for the midwife. Meanwhile, Chummy worries about her mother's illness when she discovers Lady Browne has discharged herself from hospital. Jessica Raine and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actress's disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Waterman's daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star.

credits.director: Don Maddox features in the footage
he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Nikki and Jack attend the scene of a fatal car crash in which a driver lost control of her vehicle and the forensic evidence suggests it may not have been an accident and that the victim's son Kevin McDowd - a resident of Kingscote Bows care home - could be involved in the death. The teams begin to notice a pattern of foul play and a connection between the care home and other suspicious deaths that had previously gone unnoticed, while Kevin absconds and takes his friend Serena with him.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. The team discovers a DNA match between a medical student reported missing six years previously and a corpse that was found at around the same time. Investigations into the man's background reveal he had been suspected of having links to terrorist organisations - but Boyd believes a high-level cover-up is obscuring the whole truth about the case. Guest starring Don Warrington.

programme.title: Mansfield Park
programme.desc: Part three of six. Maria gets engaged to Mr Rushworth but is still in love with Henry, while Edmund remains infatuated with Mary - much to Fanny's annoyance.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Mrs Boswell is about to celebrate her birthday when she receives some shattering news. Aveline gets a lecture on motherhood.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Old Mill Herbary at Bodmin, Cornwall, where a wide range of herbs and medicinal plants are cultivated.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As June prepares for her final day at Sun Hill, Jim finally comes clean and reveals the full extent of his gambling debts - but far from saving his marriage, the admission causes her to storm off in disgust, swearing to have nothing more to do with him. And just when Jim thinks things couldn't possibly get any worse, the hapless copper is abducted and roughed up by vicious loan shark Zaccadelli. Elsewhere, Yvonne discovers her sister has been attacked at home and suspects Shirley is responsible, while Steve is cock-a-hoop after his night with Amber - but she soon brings him down to earth.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Connie is determined to keep everything running smoothly when a health minister visits the hospital, but Lisa sees an opportunity to drum up support for her mentoring scheme. While treating an elderly couple, Jess comes to the realisation that she doesn't love Sean and breaks up with him, turning to her father for emotional support. The tension between Mickie and Mubbs finally comes to a head when she tells him she's gay. Later, an unexpected encounter at the official reception gives him a chance to drown his sorrows.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jayne prepares to unveil her mural overlooking reception, but suffers an accident on the way to the event. Josh learns the official cause of the blaze that claimed his family, while Jude is found by colleagues in a pool of blood.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gabriel learns Smithy reported him over Kerry's rape allegation and the two come to blows - but retribution comes from an unexpected source when the corrupt copper is gunned down by the Sun Hill sniper. Elsewhere, suspicion falls on Shirley after Yvonne's niece accidentally swallows an Ecstasy tablet, Ramani fears Terry is letting his personal preoccupations interfere with his police work, and a shamefaced Jim tells his colleagues that June has left him.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The highs and lows of life with the residents of Albert Square, Walford.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: As preparations are made in court for the Maddox tribunal, Hallam confronts the young firefighter himself. Meanwhile, George realises he has blown it with his girlfriend, Julia.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dealer falls under the suspicion of an ambitious and ruthless police officer, who suspects he is handling stolen European furniture. Meanwhile, Tinker joins Eric for a brief holiday in Essex, where they soon become involved in a smuggling racket. Warren Mitchell and Reece Dinsdale guest star, with Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim is assigned to guard a mainland MP who has come to Jersey to study the island's police force - but nothing prepares him for the torrid time ahead. Drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Joey promises Billy the use of his Jaguar, and Jack and Adrian run into trouble with some local thugs when a deal goes wrong.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Captain Peacock becomes infatuated with another woman and the staff rally round to conceal the fact from his wife. However, his willingness to go to extreme measures to solve his problem takes Mr Humphries' breath away. Comedy, starring Frank Thornton and John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean tries to organise a new secretary for Lionel, who is troubled by discussions regarding the mini-series. Rocky's honeymoon with Madge ends in hospital after an unfortunate canoeing accident. Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: What started as a joke takes on a life of its own when Clegg tells Howard that he was adopted and that his real parents are dead. Alvin is very insistent that he will get a kite to fly - and finds several ways to try to get it done. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Brian Murphy.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The unlikely crime-fighting duo investigate the murder of a Sikh woman whose death has unleashed simmering racial tensions in the town, but as corruption and political intrigue erupt around them, they find that love can thrive against all the odds.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the crime drama, starring Amanda Redman as Superintendent Sandra Pullman, a rising star of the Met who is sidelined after a failed hostage rescue. Put in charge of a new department, she is dismayed to discover the unit is to be manned by a motley crew of old-school former detectives who know little about modern police procedure. However, when they re-examine the case of a man whose conviction for murder 20 years ago has just been overturned, their combined experience and unorthodox methods bring interesting results. Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and James Bolam play Redman's veteran team, with Jon Finch, Tim Woodwork and Philip Bretherton.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The Glaswegian detective is drawn into a suicide case where all is not as it seems - despite his usual attempts to stay out of such investigations. Drama, with Mark McManus, James MacPherson and Blythe Duff, with early appearances from Jason Isaacs (Star Trek Discovery), Deepak Verma (EastEnders) and Meera Syal (Paddington 2). It was directed by Gordon Flemyng, who helmed two Doctor Who big screen offerings, and classic episodes of The Avengers, The Saint and Minder.

programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five friends from Dundee answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Vicky, Dexter, Francesca and Dave, who have never met before, pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: During the opening day of Hawkford Outdoor Pursuits, Jai is stressed and exhausted, while Laurel is left horrified.

programme.title: The Metro: A Rail Life Story
programme.desc: Tens of thousands of Newcastle United fans pass through the Metro for a home game on the first day of the new football season - and many of them are far from pleased with the club's owner. A guide horse undergoes training on the Metro system before moving to London, and in Sunderland, a crackdown on fare dodgers gets underway.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A touring dance extravaganza comes to Midsomer, but nobody sees the vicious rivalries and long-running feuds that are brewing behind the scenes - at least not until they erupt into murder. Barnaby's investigation into the killing of a dancer is complicated by an unexpected visit from his father, while the sponsor of the event is at the centre of a conflict of his own as he tries to decide who should inherit his fortune. Guest starring Nigel Havers and Christopher Timothy, as well as former Strictly Come Dancing stars Cassidy Little, Faye Tozer, Danny Mac, Natalie Gumede and Tom Chambers.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: Stan and his number two Mick Clark speak to Jeremy and relatives of the murdered family, but their picture of what really happened at White House Farm remains inconclusive. The twins' father Colin Caffell is devastated by his loss, and is initially comforted by Jeremy, while post-mortem examinations reveal nothing to contradict the murder-suicide theory. Meanwhile, relative Ann Eaton cannot believe Sheila was responsible, and discusses her growing suspicions with her brother David Boutflour.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef travels through France to visit the locations that inspired his culinary career, beginning at the Chateau Cheval Blanc in Saint-Emilion, before going back to the kitchens of the Hostellerie de Plaisance, where he worked as a lad more than 30 years ago. He rounds off his trip by cooking at an award-winning vineyard.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tyrone and Fiz are horrified to discover the back door unlocked and Hope gone. Tim's shocked to find Charlie on his doorstep, and she tells him he can forget about the divorce as she cannot afford the legal fees. Bethany is gutted when Alya reveals that Ray has made her the bistro's new manager.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: For the next leg of their journey, Bradley and Barney visit the Red River Gorge in Kentucky, before heading to the supposedly haunted Poasttown Elementary School in Middletown, Ohio. The next day, they travel to Louisville, birthplace of legendary boxer Muhammad Ali, where they follow in his footsteps by sparring at the local boxing gym. At the end of a long day, Barney rewards his dad with a well-earned meal at a KFC restaurant in Kentucky - the home state of the chain's founder Colonel Harland Sanders.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz shows the police the passports and ferry tickets, convinced Jade has abducted Hope. Carla tells an appalled Bethany how Ray made Michelle sign a gagging order, and Charlie returns to No 4 with her bags and explains she's been evicted.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: After a vital discovery at the farm, Stan and Mick feel closer to shoring up their own suspicions about Jeremy. The arrival of Brett, a friend from New Zealand (played by Game of Thrones star Alfie Allen), increases tensions between Jeremy and Julie, while Ann grows ever more alarmed and suspicious of her cousin Jeremy's behaviour, and his handling of the family estate. As preparations for the inquest continue, Stan is concerned that if the bodies are released for cremation, vital evidence will be lost for ever.

programme.desc: Retirees from Padstow blow a big budget on an oak porch for their renovation, and a property transformation in Liverpool uncovers a slice of history. Elsewhere, the development of a loft conversion for a family living in North London does not go according to plan.

programme.desc: It is the opening day of Hawksford Outdoor Pursuits, and while Rhona surprises Marlon, he is left determined.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Holidays: Bagging a Bargain Break - Tonight
programme.desc: Helen Skelton presents a report on the tourism industry, asking how easy it will be to get a bargain holiday in 2020 in the aftermath of the Thomas Cook collapse.

programme.title: Inside the Crown: Secrets of the Royals
programme.desc: Major documentary telling the inside story of the royal family and the Queen's record-breaking reign. The first episode focuses on the conflict between love and duty that faces the royals - and which has occasionally threatened to bring down the House of Windsor. Edward VIII fatefully chose love when he abdicated to marry divorcee Wallis Simpson. Charles chose duty when he married Diana. The Queen, however, has managed to find a balance, maintaining a long marriage while becoming the longest-serving monarch.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: At a time of year when many people feel the pinch in both their wallets and their waistlines, the consumer health show returns, presented by Sian Williams and Ranj Singh. Over the series they compare 12 of the latest diets, beginning with the 16:8 intermittent fasting diet and a meal replacement shake plan. They also find out how it's possible to have a drink ruining blowing a diet, investigating some of the latest low-calorie and low-alcohol tipples on the market.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: After Will and Leonard witness a deadly and deliberate hit-and-run, Geordie traces the car to a pair of decidedly dysfunctional brothers, whose house lies far off the beaten path. The victim's wife, his employee and the two brothers are all damaged characters caught in a web of lies and betrayals - and it's not just secrets hiding within the siblings' grounds. Back at home, Will and Geordie both struggle as unwelcome guests look set to stay - Will's mum Amelia seems to have found a carbon copy of his late father in her new beau. Meanwhile, a new television set lands in the vicarage - just in time for Eurovision. Robson Green, Tom Brittney and Al Weaver star.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Comedian Rowland Rivron puts on a dinner party at his home as he plays mystery host to four strangers. Presented by Brian McFadden.

Mark parts with the pounds to pay for a plane ride, Michael fails to work his magic for some Harry Potter paraphernalia and Alison is as 'divine' as the painting she pays for.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: In the final instalment set during the opening of Hawkford Outdoor Pursuits, Graham's day unfolds, and a series of flashbacks reveal the truth.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Yasmeen finds Jade lying unconscious in the ginnel, and Fiz looks like the prime suspect. Charlie tells Tim how much cash she wants before she will sign any divorce papers. Bethany discusses career options with Daniel, but he suggests she might be best to leave Weatherfield altogether.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia visits the glamorous island of Santorini, beginning in one of its most exclusive hotels where she discovers how one of the Aegean's poorest islands became the playground for the rich and famous. Striking away from the bustling crowds, Julia heads inland for a walk on the wild side, hiking through a forager's paradise to the hilltop village of Pyrgos to watch the sun go down. After sampling a local delicacy made from fava beans, she heads out to sea to find out how local fishermen are joining forces with environmentalists to keep Santorini's pristine waters plastic-free.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: The police wonder if Fiz can shed any light on Jade's assault, Daniel panics as he takes Bertie's temperature, and Bernie tells Paul that she is moving on. Meanwhile, Tim's plan to send Charlie on her way doesn't work out as planned when he finds her working at the Rovers.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Will and Ellie go on their first date with a trip to the flicks. However, a scream from the projection booth cuts the romance short as they discover a brutal murder has taken place within the cinema. Geordie arrives to investigate and soon they've found movie star connections, oddball employees and a link to the Asian subcontinent, as a shadowy figure emerges from Jack Chapman's past and refuses to retreat without causing a stir. Cathy's mother takes the children out for the day, which ends up worrying Cathy far more than it should. Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Lauren Carse and Kacey Ainsworth star.

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: Adam and Karen's new living arrangements cause chaos for the family when an unexpected visitor tips them over the edge. Elsewhere, David embraces his new role, but faces humiliation from a former adversary, while Pete's time on a jury has unexpected consequences for Adam. John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst star in Mike Bullen's long-running comedy drama, with guest appearances by Gemma Jones, Clare Keelan and Sunetra Sarker.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Following Trisha Goddard's elimination last week, the remaining 11 celebrities and their professional partners perform routines from famous musicals. They will be hoping to get a high score from judges Jayne Torvill, Christopher Dean, Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman - not to mention plenty of viewer votes - and avoid having to compete in the skate-off. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.desc: Dave wants to learn to play the drums at school, but is given the recorder. With a talent show around the corner, Dave gets practising..

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Virgil and Gordon must rescue a trapped urban-explorer in a trash mine, while Brains attempts a risky mission. Guest starring Sheridan Smith.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by guests Julia Bradbury and Jodie Kidd, as well as chefs Michel Roux Sr and Sat Bains, and Extreme Cake Maker Rosie Dummer. Oz Clarke presents a guide to the best wines to serve for Chinese New Year.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up a plant-based lasagne, a vegan breakfast - including smoky barbecue beans, vegan scrambled eggs and a meat-free alternative to bacon - and salted caramel apple crumble with custard. The duo also try to convince meat-loving weatherman Alex Beresford that their big bosh burger is as good as the meaty ones he loves, and for their snack hacks, they show off their recipes for nut butters.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle recalculates the height of England's highest mountain, Scafell Pike, with the team from the Ordnance Survey. Liz Bonnin visits Cheshire's Lyme Park to witness one of autumn's greatest natural wonders - the red deer rut. Plus, chef Gino D'Acampo invites viewers to his adopted home county of Hertfordshire to find woodland ingredients for his mushroom bruschetta.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV: Live from Cheltenham
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the 2.25 Cotswold Steeple Chase and 3.35 Gallardhomes.com Cleeve Hurdle, and races at 1.50 and 3.00 from Cheltenham. Plus, races from 2.05, 2.40 and 3.15 at Doncaster. With analysis from Ruby Walsh and Mick Fitzgerald, reports by Alice Plunkett, Matt Chapman, Oli Bell and Luke Harvey, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the show's most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shepherd, in which the the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as another four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but anyone caught by the Chaser is out for good, leaving fewer players to team up and play in the final chase.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants Chris Hoy, Martine McCutcheon and Faye Tozer to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Donny Osmond joins regular panellists Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross and Davina McCall on this edition of the singing contest, as they attempt to guess the identities of the six famous faces performing from behind bizarre costumes. At the end of this week's show, a fifth singer will be unmasked and eliminated. Hosted by Joel Dommett.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: The spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity coaches seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Meghan Trainor is the newest recruit to the judging panel, joining series regulars Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Will.i.am.

programme.title: Shopping with Keith Lemon
programme.desc: The funnyman takes Spice Girl Mel B to do her big weekly food shop and has a good chat along the way, as well as visiting a London tailor with Jimmy Carr.

programme.title: Bridesmaids (2011)
programme.desc: A disorganised woman is asked to be maid of honour at her best friend's wedding. Taking charge of the prenuptial bridal celebrations, she resolves to give her pal and accompanying bridesmaids the time of their lives, but as her efforts slide into chaos she finds the wife of the groom's boss is keen to usurp her position. Comedy, with Kristen Wiig, Rose Byrne and Melissa McCarthy.

programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by a team of specialist pet trainers as they teach a range of animals to pull off incredible tricks.
