programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents a Coronation Street edition of the quiz, as celebrity contestants Shelley King, Daniel Brocklebank, Kym Marsh and Jack P Shepherd pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The celebrities and their professional partners perform yet again, hoping to get a high score from the judges - not to mention plenty of viewer votes - and avoid following Trisha Goddard and Lucrezia Millarini in being eliminated from the contest. And while the votes are being counted, Jane Torvill and Christopher Dean take to the ice to show the contestants how it should be done. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Cleaner Luke Sumner's body is discovered close to his flat in Newcastle, but pathology concludes that the killing blow could have occurred several hours before he succumbed to his injuries, prompting Vera to piece together the victim's final hours in order to investigate his murder. But Luke lived a simple life and had even severed all ties to the quaint rural village where he grew up - including his mother Carmel. Can she shed any light on her son's murder?.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: For the next leg of their journey, Bradley and Barney visit the Red River Gorge in Kentucky, before heading to the supposedly haunted Poasttown Elementary School in Middletown, Ohio. The next day, they travel to Louisville, birthplace of legendary boxer Muhammad Ali, where they follow in his footsteps by sparring at the local boxing gym. At the end of a long day, Barney rewards his dad with a well-earned meal at a KFC restaurant in Kentucky - the home state of the chain's founder Colonel Harland Sanders.

programme.title: The Metro: A Rail Life Story
programme.desc: Tens of thousands of Newcastle United fans pass through the Metro for a home game on the first day of the new football season - and many of them are far from pleased with the club's owner. A guide horse undergoes training on the Metro system before moving to London, and in Sunderland, a crackdown on fare dodgers gets underway.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Laura's worst fears come to pass and her hidden past is exposed, but she must fight to put her personal struggles aside for the sake of one of her pupils, whose physical distress throws her unexpectedly at the mercy of Andrew Earlham. Vanessa also finds her resolve shaken after an unsettling encounter with Andrew.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Actor and entertainer Shane Richie, Countdown's resident number-cruncher Rachel Riley, and Blur bassist Alex James form the panel this week, as Keith Lemon infiltrates another three mystery celebrities' homes. As ever, the host will be pointing out a selection of tell-tale possessions that may - or may not - hint at the identity of each property's occupant, and the three stars in the studio must guess 'who habitates in a house like this'.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Former snooker player Willie Thorne is today's VIP cook, providing a selection of dishes for four guests who have to guess his identity. If the diners are successful, they will be one step closer to winning the full cash prize - but if they fail, they will be the ones doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Tom Hanks and co-star Matthew Rhys chat about their new film A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood, which is about beloved US children's TV presenter Fred Rogers.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Actor and director Clint Eastwood sits down with Alison Hammond in Los Angeles to chat about his new film Richard Jewell.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and topical studio discussion from a female perspective.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five family members answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh asks the questions as contestants Danielle, Anthony, Gareth and Sue pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.desc: As January, the toughest month for many people, continues, the financial journalist and Angellica Bell look at what solutions there might be for cutting mounting debts, including comparing the pros and cons of loans and credit cards.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: Adam reaches out to Laura, but risks upsetting his family as a result, while Karen and Jenny's weekend away is hijacked by their mothers. Pete's attempts to reunite the Three Amigos ends in disaster. John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst star in Mike Bullen's long-running comedy drama, with Sacha Parkinson, Gemma Jones, Clare Keelan and Sunetra Sarker.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Inside the Crown: Secrets of the Royals
programme.desc: Major documentary telling the inside story of the royal family and the Queen's record-breaking reign. The first episode focuses on the conflict between love and duty that faces the royals - and which has occasionally threatened to bring down the House of Windsor. Edward VIII fatefully chose love when he abdicated to marry divorcee Wallis Simpson. Charles chose duty when he married Diana. The Queen, however, has managed to find a balance, maintaining a long marriage while becoming the longest-serving monarch.

programme.title: Rebound
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher hosts the quickfire quiz that tests the general knowledge of six contestants, who go head to head in a bid to walk away with a big cash prize. The players must give as many correct answers as they can in the time it takes the 'Rebound Bar' to move across the studio, with the money on offer rising accordingly.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends calling themselves the Science Alliance answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.
